intro: Phyllanthus razakamalalae, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant diversity in Madagascar.
